title.native: ゾンビランドサガ リベンジ

description:
The second season of Zombie Land Saga.

From throughout the ages, a group of legendary girls have become zombie idols to save Saga Prefecture. It's the return of the cutting-edge zombie idol anime! One day, Minamoto Sakura lost her life in an unfortunate accident. Then, ten years later… After Sakura wakes up in a strange mansion, mysterious idol producer Tatsumi Kotaro tells her that she will be joining a group of legendary girls to form an idol unit. The seven girls are charged with a quest to save the fading Saga Prefecture and adopt the group name Franchouchou. After overcoming the difficulties stemming from their different ages and different periods of history, their undead zombie bodies allow them to defy expectations of what idols can be. During the final winter of the Heisei era they performed their first featured concert at Karatsu's Furusato Exhibition Hall, Arpino, taking another step towards becoming a legend. Now, in the modern Reiwa Era… The curtain rises on a new chapter in the story of Franchouchou, as they march towards a bright future full of hope.

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: ซอมบี้เเลนด์ซากะ Revenge

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Zombie
tags.description: Prominently features reanimated corpses which often prey on live humans and turn them into zombies.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Dancing
tags.description: Centers around the art of dance.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Natural Disaster
tags.description: It focuses on catastrophic events of natural origin, such as earthquakes, tsunamis,  volcanic eruptions, and severe storms. These works often present situations of extreme danger in which the characters struggle to survive and overcome the adversity.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: Satire
tags.description: Prominently features the use of comedy or ridicule to expose and criticise social phenomena.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Oiran
tags.description: Prominently features a courtesan character of the Japanese Edo Period.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Transgender
tags.description: Features a character whose gender identity differs from the sex they were assigned at birth.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Rural
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the countryside.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Bar
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a bar.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Rakugo
tags.description: Rakugo is the traditional Japanese performance art of comic storytelling.

tags.name: Achronological Order
tags.description: Chapters or episodes do not occur in chronological order.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Aliens
tags.description: Prominently features extraterrestrial lifeforms.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

alternative: Densetsu no Shouwa Idol (伝説の昭和アイドル)
Dorami Hachidaime Souchou (怒羅美八代目総長)

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/munehisa_sakai)

Previoulsy affiliated with [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/Toei-Animation) and [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/MAPPA). Currently working at [Studio KAI](https://anilist.co/studio/6312/Studio-KAI).

Funta is a duo consisting of vocalist/songwriter UCO (U子) and guitarist/keyboardist Yoshimi (吉見). The Funta "sound" can be characterized as having a strong pop rock sensibility with a tendency toward electronic elements and moe-pop vocals.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/munehisa_sakai)

Previoulsy affiliated with [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/Toei-Animation) and [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/MAPPA). Currently working at [Studio KAI](https://anilist.co/studio/6312/Studio-KAI).
Previously working at Tavac, now for Real-T.

__Agency:__ Office Osawa
 
[Profile](https://osawa-inc.co.jp/women/tanedarisa/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tane_da_dayo/)

On September 1, 2016, Office Osawa announced that Taneda would put her career on hiatus to focus on treatment for her throat, various roles she done were recast during this time such as Erina Nakiri from Food Wars who was replaced by Hisako Kanemoto from Season 3 and onwards.

On August 4, 2017, Office Osawa announced that her treatment was successful and she would gradually return to voice acting.

__Non-anime roles:__
~!
• D.Va in "Overwatch" (VG)
• Kuon in Utawarerumono (VG series)
• Shirasu Azusa in Blue Archive (VG)
!~

**Height:** 157cm

[Profile](https://firstwind.co.jp/talentpage/kinugawa_rika/)

She is a voice actress currently affiliated with FIRST WIND. Previously she was under With Line.

__Agency:__ I'm Enterprise

[Agency Profile](https://www.imenterprise.jp/profile.php?id=78) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Hondo_dagaya_)

A Japanese voice actor affiliated with I'm Enterprise.

Hondo had an interest in anime from a young age, in particular the [Naruto](https://anilist.co/anime/20/) series. She became interested in acting and modelling while in elementary school. She made her voice acting debut in 2015, and later that same year, she was cast in her first main role as [Kokoro Yotsuba](https://anilist.co/character/134716/), the protagonist of the anime series [Kamisama Minarai: Himitsu no Cocotama](https://anilist.co/anime/21237/).

She won Best New Actress at the 13th Seiyuu Awards for her role as [Hitomi Mishima](https://anilist.co/character/89230/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Lunalynn - Memento Mori (VG)
- Novel - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Ciel - Tsukihime -A piece of blue glass moon- (VN)
- Voyager - Reverse: 1999 (VG)
- Ajitani Hifumi - Blue Archive (VG)
- Phoebe - Wuthering Waves (VG) 
- Motoha Arai - Persona 5: The Phantom X (VG)

[Profile (81 Produce)](https://www.81produce.co.jp/dcms_plusdb/index.php/item?cell003=%E3%81%9F%E8%A1%8C&cell029=%E5%A5%B3%E6%80%A7&keyword=&cell028=&cell004=&name=%E7%94%B0%E4%B8%AD%E3%80%80%E7%BE%8E%E6%B5%B7&id=242&label=1) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/minazou_373) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/minazou_in_sta/)

Announced her marriage on November 22, 2023.

**Non-anime roles:**
- [Alice](https://anilist.co/character/292758/Tendou-Alice) - Blue Archive (Video Game)
- Linaria - Granblue Fantasy (Video Game)
- Urakaze, Wakaba - Azur Lane (Video Game)
- Rover (Female) - Wuthering Waves (Video Game)

[Blog](http://blog.amuse.co.jp/tanoasami/p/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/asami_manager) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tano_asami/)

Asami Tano is a Japanese actress and voice actress from Hyōgo Prefecture, Japan. She is affiliated with Amuse, Inc. Her voice acting career began with Toriko in 2011, and she has starred in several anime such as Smile PreCure, Francesca, Love Live! Sunshine!!, and Zombie Land Saga.

On 13 December 2021, she announced her marriage to [Ryou Kitamura](https://anilist.co/staff/128201).

**Non-Anime Roles:**
- Citlali - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Fediel -Granblue Fantasy (VG)

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/takenakanobuhi)__

__Takenaka Nobuhiro__ is a Japanese producer, who also provides supervision to some works.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Kimu777)

Makoto Kimura is an animation producer originally from Fuji TV Noitamina. He then moved to [Twin Engine](https://anilist.co/studio/6199/Twin-Engine) and later then to Studio [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/MAPPA) where he was the Director of Planning Department. In April 2024, he left MAPPA and formed BLUE RIGHTS Co. Ltd.

_Note: Not to be confused with the background artist [Makoto Kimura](https://anilist.co/staff/182523/)._
